an6.68:1.1: “Mendicants, it is quite impossible that a mendicant who enjoys company and groups, who loves them and likes to enjoy them, should take pleasure in being alone in seclusion.
an6.68:1.2: Without taking pleasure in being alone in seclusion, it’s impossible to learn the patterns of the mind.
an6.68:1.3: Without learning the mind’s character, it’s impossible to fulfill right view.
an6.68:1.4: Without fulfilling right view, it’s impossible to fulfill right immersion.
an6.68:1.5: Without fulfilling right immersion, it’s impossible to give up the fetters.
an6.68:1.6: Without giving up the fetters, it’s impossible to realize extinguishment.
an6.68:2.1: It’s quite possible that a mendicant who doesn’t enjoy company and groups, who doesn’t love them and like to enjoy them, should take pleasure in being alone in seclusion.
an6.68:2.2: For someone who takes pleasure in being alone in seclusion, it’s possible to learn the mind’s character.
an6.68:2.3: For someone who learns the mind’s character, it’s possible to fulfill right view.
an6.68:2.4: Having fulfilled right view, it’s possible to fulfill right immersion.
an6.68:2.5: Having fulfilled right immersion, it’s possible to give up the fetters.
an6.68:2.6: Having given up the fetters, it’s possible to realize extinguishment.”
